text: A statement from the Office of Raúl M. Grijalva. https://t.co/DJkWNfwHfn

President Trump’s latest reckless decision to fire thousands of employees at the Department of Education jeopardizes critical student aid programs, weakens protections for students’ civil rights, and undermines essential support for students with disabilities. This move severely threatens every child’s access to a quality education nationwide.

Trump and Musk are prioritizing tax cuts for the wealthy over the future of our students.  It’s selfish, and it’s illegal. This radical gutting of the Department will mean funding cuts for every student:

- 26 million kids across every school district—rural, suburban and urban—will lose access to critical funding to help them get succeed. 

- 12 million students will lose access to career and technical education, including pathways to good-paying jobs through apprenticeship programs in trades and STEM careers. 

- 10 million students from low-income families could lose access to higher education.  

- 7.5 million students with Individualized Education Plans—accounting for 15 percent of all students nationwide —will lose access to special education services.

Corporate profits are at an all time high but a majority of Americans are still underpaid. The bipartisan #PROAct protects and strengthens the basic right of American to stand together and negotiate higher wages, better benefits, and safer working conditions. 

My full statement on why I proudly cosponsor the PRO Act. 
https://t.co/ypPYs7Vc55

Millionaire earners stop paying into Social Security today. They should pay in ALL year long on ALL of their income, just like the rest of us. 

Then, we can protect and expand benefits! #ScrapTheCap

In true form, President Trump spent the entirety of his Joint Address lying to Americans that his last six weeks burning the U.S. government to the ground will some how benefit them. 

Read my full statement on last night's Joint Address. 

https://t.co/LJ2ggDhZ1B

In only in Trump’s reality is America back again…

➡️ Rising costs of living everyday for our working and middles class.

➡️ The slashing of crucial government agencies & programs hardworking Americans rely on.

➡️ Constant attacks to our immigrant and LGBTQIA+ communities.

➡️ Selling our country out to special interests. 

We cannot let this be what our nation stands for.

President Trump’s attempt to shutter the Consumer Finance Protection Board (CFPB) shows his determination to steal hard-earned money from the American people and reward billionaire donors and big corporations. 

The CFPB has saved families $21 billion. The American people cannot afford Trump’s extreme agenda. I am proud to stand alongside Sen. Warren and demand the Trump administration restore the CFPB

Every American who's able & willing to serve should be allowed to.
  
President Trump's decision to oust servicemembers JUST because they're trans is dangerous, unconstitutional, and threatens our military's readiness.

This week, roughly 4,400 U.S. National Park Service and Forest Service employees lost their jobs. These are dedicated public servants who are committed to safeguarding our treasured public lands and historic places. They clean and maintain the parks, conduct search and rescue operations, ensure safety ensure safety and provide education for all visitors. 

We must protect our public lands, which means standing up for those who care for them.

Housing costs & evictions skyrocketed under the first Trump Administration while corporate landlords bought up the housing stock.💔 

I am committed on supporting @USHouseFSC's efforts of securing robust investments in fair and affordable housing .🏠 #ShowHousingLOVE https://t.co/AJNJU2pdVU

As elected officials, Members of Congress have important oversight duties. Trump, Musk and their DOGE cronies have consistently blocked our access to federal buildings and impeded our work towards transparency and accountability. 

I’m proud to cosponsor the All Access Act of 2025 to ensure that members of Congress can access the facilities we are tasked with overseeing.

House Republicans are proposing a $230 billion cut to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), would substantially slash benefits that millions of low-income families rely on... Why are my Republican colleagues intent on making it harder for Americans to put food on the table?

Who do these drastic cuts benefit? Definitely not the American people.

The @EqualityCaucus  today announced a historic 191 Members of the U.S. House have joined the Congressional Equality Caucus this Congress – the most ever at the start of a Congress!
As a proud ally to the LGBTQI+ community, I’m honored to re-join the Congressional Equality Caucus for the 119th Congress. I will not stand by while Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress attack the rights and dignity of LGBTQI+ people. As a Member of the Equality Caucus, I’m going to fight every day for the LGBTQI+ community in Arizona because I believe the only person who should get a say in how you live your life is YOU—not your Congressman, not your Senator, and definitely not Donald Trump.

Republicans are starting to rethink their love affair with Elon Musk, and it's about time! 

Let's focus on policies that benefit everyone, not just tech moguls with massive egos. It's time to fire Elon Musk!
https://t.co/pUoaRwPEJa

Closing the U.S. Department of Education would undermine equity and quality in Arizona schools. Federal support ensures funding for low-income students, special education, teacher support and higher education. Arizona deserves stronger educational leadership, not less. #ProtectPublicEd

https://t.co/rwOyegya1i

Every athlete deserves respect, dignity, and equal opportunities. We stand with our transgender athletes and reject discriminatory policies that aim to erase their identities and abilities. #TransRightsAreHumanRights
I’m looking forward to reviewing the bill that Rep. Pocan is introducing.

President Trump cannot unilaterally end birthright citizenship—it’s protected by the 14th Amendment. Our Constitution guarantees that all children born in the U.S. are citizens, and no executive order can strip away that fundamental right. The courts agree.

There is absolutely no legal authority for the U.S. to take over the land of Gaza and occupy it for any length of time. Zero. 

This is the exact opposite of not intervening in foreign affairs Trump touted on the campaign trail.

The U.S. should never outsource its prison system—especially to a government with a history of human rights abuses and where due process is not guaranteed. Mass incarceration is not a business opportunity. 
We must focus on justice, rehabilitation, and reform, never profit. Such an action by the Trump Administration would not only be illegal but also contradict everything our nation stands for.

For the second time this week, Democrats stood up for working people and forced Trump to back down. His reckless tariffs would’ve raised prices on food, gas, and housing—hurting everyday families and costing jobs. 
Democrats will continue fighting for taxpayers, while Trump & Republicans put billionaires first.
Trump's tariffs will hurt hardworking families. https://t.co/fslK0pKJDW
Dismantling USAID and turning foreign aid over to private billionaires is NOT legal. USAID is authorized and funded by Congress. This is a complete overreach by the Trump administration.

I am aware of the conservative student group at ASU planning an event encouraging students to report their peers for immigration enforcement action. My office has spoken with university officials and is monitoring the situation to ensure students feel safe and are free from harassment.

My deepest condolences to the families affected by this tragic accident. The NTSB is leading the investigation and it’s critical we let them do their work before jumping to conclusions. This isn’t the time for speculation, especially on issues like DEI, which are irrelevant here. I also want to thank the brave first responders who continue to work under incredibly difficult conditions.

Today, on International Holocaust Remembrance Day, we honor the millions of lives lost and the survivors who carry the memory of this atrocity. 

As a nation, we must stand united in ensuring that the horrors of the Holocaust are never forgotten. We must continue to speak out against hatred, antisemitism, and religious persecution.

"This is a blatantly unconstitutional order." — U.S. District Judge John Coughenour

These executive orders are not solutions—they harm families, workers, and our economy. 

The @HispanicCaucus is committed to building an economy that works for everyone, not chaos caused by political stunts.

Barely 24 hours into his term, Trump has managed to effectively reverse decades of progress including removing protections for the LGBTQIA+ community, villainizing immigrants, attempting to circumvent the US Constitution and Congress to implement his immigration policies, and rolling back environmental protections.
This Administration is already proving they are on the side of special interests and xenophobes, not the American people.

President Trump has begun his four years with a grift on the American people by launching a cryptocurrency the night before his inauguration. This is a brazen and unethical money grab that will leave his unsuspecting supporters to pay the tab.  

Make no mistake— this presidency is already putting the needs of Trump himself and his billionaire tech friends ahead of the American people. Instead of making a plan to drive down housing, health care, and grocery costs for those who elected him, he is focusing on lining his own pockets. 

Democrats must stand up to Trump’s worst impulses and grifting tendencies if we are to come away from this a stronger, more prosperous nation.

President Carter was a humanitarian to the core. First dedicating himself to the country, and later proving himself to the world. His life of service will be held up as an example of the truest form of a public servant for generations.

14 years ago today, a gunman shot and killed 6 people and injured 12 at a congressional event forever changing lives, and our community.

We honor their memory and reassert out commitment to preventing gun violence in our communities
Reflecting on 10 years of work leading the Natural Resources Committee - fighting for our environment, our communities and our future.

House Republicans are spineless. Trump isn't in office yet, but on his orders they are threatening to kill a bipartisan government funding bill and shut down our federal government. 
Republicans should be standing up for the hard working people they are supposed to represent, not Trump and his special interest groupies.

I am deeply saddened by another violent event at a school. My heart goes out to the families suffering from today's tragedy. No child should fear for their life at school. Teachers should not doubt their safety in a classroom.  I will continue to fight for widely support reforms for gun safety that can help save lives and prevent senseless gun deaths. Members of Congress must stop with excuses and have the courage to act — the lives of our children depend on it.

These next four years will be a fight against the Trump Administration & House Republicans. The House Natural Resource Committee will be the frontline to ensuring the strides we have made in advancing environmental justice, strengthening tribal sovereignty, and protecting our public lands doesn’t crumble under the Trump Administration & House Republican leadership.

I am proud to endorse my friend and colleague, @Rep_Stansbury for Ranking Member of the House Natural Resources Committee. She has the experience, vision, policy acuity, and resolve we need to defend and further the historic progress Committee Democrats have made in charting a cleaner, safer, more just future for every American.
House Republicans are already making plans to reward their biggest donors with massive tax breaks, while doing nothing to make life more affordable for working class Americans.
I agree with Rep. Doggett and will also vote against HR 9495.

I’m grateful to my community and #AZ07 for giving me another opportunity to represent them in my final term. This was not the outcome that we expected, and unfortunately, progress is not always linear. Please know that my office will continue to serve all of those I represent in Arizona, and it is too soon to know the impacts of the transition to a second Trump administration. But we will not stop the top-notch constituent services that we provide for Southern Arizonans.

As we enter this new and uncertain period, we will not succumb to despair. We will not scapegoat. We will not compromise on our values.

Moving forward, we must fight to prioritize and preserve the advances we’ve made on equity, economic fairness, justice, and inclusivity. We will defend the rule of law and American democracy. And together, we will build the future that we want to see for our children and grandchildren.

Once again, former President Trump shows he lacks any knowledge of how tariffs work and their impact on the people of Arizona. 

This proposal is bad for Arizonans, small businesses, and our economy.
